block.p: Susanne Hooshmand Vikoren, a daughter of Dr. Farah Hooshmand Vikoren and Harold Bartholomay Vikoren of New Hope, Pa., was married yesterday to Christopher John Clark, a son of Kathleen Kelly Clark and John A. Clark, both of Fremont, Calif. District Justice Robert A. Schnell Jr. of the Pennsylvania Court of Common Pleas in Buckingham, officiated at the Solebury Friends Meeting in Solebury, Pa. Judge Lewis A. Kaplan of Federal District Court in Manhattan, for whom the bridegroom was a law clerk, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Clark, 31, is an associate specializing in legal matters at Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. She graduated from Swarthmore College and received a law degree from Columbia University, as did the bridegroom.

Susanne Hooshmand Vikoren, a daughter of Dr. Farah Hooshmand Vikoren and Harold Bartholomay Vikoren of New Hope, Pa., was married yesterday to Christopher John Clark, a son of Kathleen Kelly Clark and John A. Clark, both of Fremont, Calif. District Justice Robert A. Schnell Jr. of the Pennsylvania Court of Common Pleas in Buckingham, officiated at the Solebury Friends Meeting in Solebury, Pa. Judge Lewis A. Kaplan of Federal District Court in Manhattan, for whom the bridegroom was a law clerk, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Clark, 31, is an associate specializing in legal matters at Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. She graduated from Swarthmore College and received a law degree from Columbia University, as did the bridegroom.
Her parents work in Doylestown, Pa., where her father has a law practice and her mother has a practice in obstetrics and gynecology.

Mr. Clark, 29, is an assistant United States attorney in Manhattan. He graduated from the University of California at Berkeley. His mother is a resource room teacher at the Oliveira Elementary School in Fremont. His father retired as the sales manager for Arow Components and Fasteners in Hayward, Calif.
